Positives include a nice location next to the ocean and being close to many restaurants, including a Starbuck across the street. It is unlikely that we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wake up to crashing waves”
Reviews.Author: TimPalmSprings
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a Saturday night in December and a pacific storm blew in that night. What a great place to be if you love the sea like I do. That was the only noise I heard all night. The rooms are comfy and oversized. The balcolnies have plenty of room to sit and watch the sea. You cannot beat this location if you like long walk and fresh air. Do your self a favour and Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great place right on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: ugogirl1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to California which included a stay at the Pacific Coast Inn. There were 4 of us in the room and although it was not a suite, we managed to fit just fine. When we arrived we were greeted by very friendly staff at this hotel who were very knowledgeable about the area and things to do. Our room had a balcony that overlooked the ocean which was wonderful to wake up to and drink coffee while watching the dolphins play out in the ocean. Although this is an older hotel, the rooms were clean and we were all content because we could walk right out to the beach and enjoy the beach fest that was going on. We did not go in the pool, but there was a pool and a jacuzzi available. There are many restaurants within walking distance and our favorite was Nicks, which everyone in the family enjoyed. This hotel is about 1 block from crystal pier which is lovely on its own. There was parking available underground although it is a tight fit down there. We had no trouble with beggars as was noted in some other reviews, I didn't even see any while we were there except for one guy out on the street trying to beg for a beer from cars passing by. The breakfast is continental and we chose to go to the IHOP that was just one block away since we have starving teenagers. All in all, we enjoyed our stay here and everyone in the family thought that it would be worth a return trip to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: saades
Reviews.Content: We were on a budget honeymoon, and this was a great place to stay. The youthful staff was kind enough to give us an ocean-front room at an affordable price. The massage school is walking distance for half price massage, too. Grab your bikes and you'll be relieved of your car as long as you're there! You'll find yourself just steps from the picturesque ocean, pier, and nearby restaurants (Kafe Yen is the best!), bars, and shops. This is not the place for you if you want luxury, but if you want to be in the center of Pacific Beach, for less than a fortune, it's fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “7/30/06-8/3/06 Stay”
Reviews.Author: Transolinc
Reviews.Content: 1. Front desk crew courteous but very young. 2. Continental breakfast is OK. At times you had difficulty getting a table mid morning. 3. Exterior of hotel needs painting and maintenance. 4. Air conditioner in room is weak. 5. This is not a Marriott or Starwoods hotel. 6. Location to beach is very nice. 7. Parking in garage is very tight. I damaged my right side driver mirror trying to park our Yukon XL last night. The parking garage is setup for compact cars. Not everyone drives a compact car. 8. Hotel maintenance staff is very courteouse and responsive. It is my guess that hotel ownership is tight with capital dollars for improvements if they can fill the hotel without too much trouble at the rates they charge. 9. The empty building across from the hotel should be torn down. It detracts from the area. 10. The fire department is one (1) building over. This is good if you have a fire and from a security perspective but bad if they are out on calls and sound the sirens. 11. Only saw a few street people. The SD PD made two (2) arrests of street people when we were there. They were very proactive in this area. 12. The location of the SD Life Guard station is very positive. The beach are by the hotel is monitored heavily. The life guard staff on the beach were very proactive on currents in the ocean. 13. The beach needs to cleaned daily from the seaweed. 14. We walked 3 miles up and down the beach and most of the folks seemed to be tourists that were on the beach. 15. You have many restaurant options within walking distance. 16. Hotel has onsite security in the evenings and after hours.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: ltp_tango
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Ocean Park Inn from Friday, July 21, to today, and I cannot wait to go back. In fact, I have booked a reservation in December. This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel, and I just love it. First of all, the hotel overlooks the ocean. You are ON the beach. Some people have complained about accommodations and service at this hotel, and granted, it is NOT the Ritz Carlton. I found the staff to be hard-working, and at times, over-worked, but friendly. I've also found that if you are nice, patient and friendly with people; they are likewise with you. We arrived in San Diego on Friday around 12:30 PM. Our room at the Ocean Park Inn was not yet ready, as they had 100 percent occupancy, and had to get the rooms cleaned for check-ins. Check-in time is 3 PM. My boyfriend and I parked our rental car in the OPI lot, and walked around the beach and went to lunch. When we checked back at 2:30 PM, our room was ready. I had booked a king, partial ocean view room on Expedia. This room was facing the pool, and beyond that, the ocean. Basically, it was an ocean front room without the ocean-front price!!!! We were thrilled!!!! This hotel is in such a great location that you don't really need a car. Unless you are going to SeaWorld or exploring San Diego, there is everything within walking distance to the hotel. My boyfriend and I walked so much that our legs and feet are sore!!! Across the street is a Ralph's grocery store; Starbucks; UNO restaurant (best pizza in town! great place!); Sketchers; Long's Drug Store; Jack in the Box; Wells Fargo ATM; 7-11. Down the street a bit is Rubio's and LaSalsa for fresh Mexican food, Taco Bell and Burger King. Next to the hotel is Taylor's Restaurant (which is good, but not great); Joe's Crab Shack (also good); and lots more of everything. For live music, try Blind Melon's (now 710 Ocean Avenue or something like that ) at the pier (two blocks away). They feature different music nightly, all of it good. For nightlife information, get a free San Diego READER magazine. For t-shirt or other beachwear shopping, try the beach front shops about 4 blocks south of the hotel. They have the BEST prices on sunglasses, postcards, t-shirts, hats, swimwear, etc. WAVE is a little pricey; try the unnamed "mom and pop" shops just past the Best Western and Surfer hotels. The OPI also offers a free continental breakfast, with cereals, fruit, bagels, sweet rolls, a variety of juices and coffee. Parking is now $7.00 per night, in a secured, underground garage. There is a microwave, refrigerator, in-room safe, hair dryer, coffee maker, iron and ironing board in each room. The beds are comfortable, and the rooms are clean. I much prefer OPI over the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge, because it is smaller and cleaner, and it caters more to families and couples than wild party people. I was very glad to be staying at the OPI instead of the Surfer Hotel, Blue Sea Lodge or other adjacent hotels, because the beach this past weekend was like Spring Break. Lots of wild, noisy, drunk 20-somethings...but none of them appeared to be staying at Ocean Park Inn. I also much prefer Pacific Beach to Ocean Beach. Ocean Beach is in an older, lower-income section of town, and I just did not feel safe in that area in general. While Pacific Beach has its share of homeless people, they tend to mind their own business. I felt quite safe walking at any time of the day or night on Pacific Beach, and there always seems to be people walking around, regardless of the hour. We will be back...

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Ocean Park Inn. The view of the ocean was beautiful and the sound of the waves was very relaxing. The continental breakfast was much better than I had expected - cereals, bagels, pastries, etc. The location is perfect. We didn't use our car during our stay because everything we needed is within walking distance. There's a supermarket across the street which came in very handy since we had a microwave and refrigerator in the room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and we can't wait until we go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Bum Problems On The Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While we have stayed several times at the Ocean Park Inn and have enjoyed our room, the hotel has definitely acquired a bum problem. Several of the same bums (approx. 10) consistently hang out directly in front of the hotel on the oceanside boardwalk drinking, yelling, changing their clothes (yes, one was naked) and asking for money from those walking on the boardwalk. We have always had a balcony room and one day, as we were eating our breakfast, a bum started throwing up directly across from us. Of course, we promptly lost our appetite and came inside the room. We have been woken up several times by bums yelling in the early-morning hours; i.e., 12:00 am - 4:00 am - and have had to call the San Diego police department several times. Unfortunately, the only thing the police can do is shoo them off, but they come back an hour or so later. As the continued problem with loitering bums has been consistently becoming worse through the years, we will not be staying at the Ocean Park Inn any longer and will take our business further north. Too bad, as we really enjoyed it here. Seems the hotel and the police department need to get more "teeth" in handling this bum issue. It destroys the beauty of San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Loyal Ocean Park customer”
Reviews.Author: khurley
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my 3rd stay at the Ocean Park Inn. After reading some of the negative reviews, I had wondered if maybe a change in staff had resulted in some bad service. Happily, this was not the case. My friend and I were greeted with smiles upon our early check in and every encounter with the staff after that was pleasant and helpful. The location of this hotel can not be beat. The view is perfect and it's within easy walking distance of a million things to do. I think that the bad reviews sprinkled through this hotels listing must be from people expecting an ocean front Ritz Carlton for the price of Motel 6. Stay at this hotel with an open mind and you will NOT be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am writing this, to let you know that the bad reviews you have read are correct. I have not stayed here, but had plans to stay here for Mothers Day weekend 2006. I booked my reservation in August 2005 and secured the 1st night with a deposit. My plans had changed and I called on Feb. 16th 2006 to cancel my reservation, and was told that it was taken care of, I also informed them that the credit card I had used to reserve with was no longer valid, they said they would mail me a refund check and no worries I would have it within 7-10 days. As of today 3/8/06 I still had not received the refund and was shocked to see that I still had a reservation there. When I called the hotel and spoke to Jade, she informed me only the GM could cancel the reservation, and that he would have to review the account to make sure I could do this. When I asked what that meant, she said that is the policy. I don't know about anyone else, but I have never been refused to cancel a reservation especially when it meets all the requirements, which in this case was a 72 hour notice, I am giving close to 72 days notice. I also spoke to a Robin who told me that the GM would have to call me back to discuss this with me. Am I too believe that the are so hard up for guest that they hold their money hostage, and try to brow beat you into staying there? As of yet I still have not heard back from anyone at this establishment, and will continue to pursue my $225.00 deposit, so I can stay elsewhere. Good luck if you decide to try this place, but keep in mind the other reviews stated that the staff was not friendly, or outgoing to please the guest, and if this is just a small sampling of their hospitality and I haven't even checked in yet, I can only imagine what it would be like had I stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Changed Room Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a nice place on the beach for my daughter and I to have a special vacation. After much research, I call this hotel on a Saturday morning. Kurt at the front desk quoted me a flat $209/night for an ocean front room with 2 queen beds for our 4 night stay. I wanted to do a little more research and be sure I had the funds, so I said I would call back. On Monday, 48 hours later, I called to book the room and was told the price was now $249 for Wed-Thurs and $349 for Fri-Sat. I spoke to the same agent and gave him the price he quoted me earlier, but he refused to honor the quoted price. If the price had gone up a little, I would have considered it, but to raise the price 40% in 48 hours and not honor an earlier quote is just plain bad business. Need less to say, we will not be staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location - room could use some updating”
Reviews.Author: ek_2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in December 2005. We chose this hotel for our stay based on its location and some of the reviews from this site. The location is great. We got an oceanfront room. The view was great but there were homeless people hanging out in front of our balcony pretty much 24 hours per day. The hotel/rooms were older and some attempts on updating them had been made. Overall, the room was very average and needed a lot more updating. The parking was $7/day. The location is great. You can walk to the beach and to a supermarket, Starbucks and restaurants. It's within a short drive to the Sea World. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Scrapbooker43
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Park Inn for 5 nights in Dec. Loved the view as we upgraded to ocean front. Very relaxing. Had a very large room which is so handy when you have so many bags of luggage. Very close to some good restaurants. Loved Old San Diego as much as the zoo and wild animal park. We spent 2 days that sea world. Would highly recommend visiting this hotel, staff were very helpful and always gave us freebies for the restaurants they recommended. Nice pool that was very warm. Being from Canada, we found the weather very warm and had the pool all to ourselves for the entire time we were there. Good breakfast with bagels, cereal, rolls, juices. Very impressed

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Manager Robin And Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thanks Ocean Park Inn!! KUDOS to the manager Robin! I had just about 400 questions about the area and places etc... and if she did not know the answer she called around or asked until she got it for me! I came to San Diego from Pittsburgh PA for the Steelers vs. the Charges Monday night game. I arrived late and the hotel, "Hilton", by the stadium that I had reservations with gave my room away. The taxi driver suggested I check hotels in other places as they were all full because of the game by the stadium. I ended up at OPI. The rooms where great, the views, for a single guy, at the beach were a, number, one and the breafast was great! I will stay there any time I visit San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Beach Front Hotel”
Reviews.Author: investorfan
Reviews.Content: I had my second stay at the Ocean Park Inn the last few days of August. I was again very pleased with the service. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The morning breakfast is plentiful. The ocean front rooms are awesome (especially on 3rd floor). The rooms are clean with all the furnishings and supplies I needed. I'm picky. For an ocean front hotel in San Diego, I will again stay at the Ocean Park Inn. Love this place.

Reviews.Title: “The best value for it's Buck”
Reviews.Author: rockinraffi
Reviews.Content: OK I don't know why people are complaining about this hotel, but it was awsome.. My girlfriend loved it so much that we are going back. There were other hotels in the area that are way more expensive but why pay that much when you can spend your money on other things in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE, DISGUSTING, and DECEIVING!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: SLWilliams
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay in late June after reading the Trip Advisor reviews. I specifically asked if there would be any construction because that seemed to be the main complaint. The reservationist said there would not be any construction during our stay in August. The week before our trip I called the hotel again to upgrade our room and could hear loud fighting and yelling in the background. I figured it was an unhappy guest and made a comment to the reservationist but she assured me it was nothing. I should have cancelled right then. Our family of four arrived at the Ocean Park Inn last week to find major consturction going on directly in front on the hotel on the life guard station. Our peaceful beach vacation that we were paying extremely high prices for ($275 per night) was not going to happen at this location. The hotel was very old and dirty, in a very rough part of town, and looks nothing like the tropical pictures posted on their website. We went in and looked at the room we had reserved (a suite) and it was dirty, small and musty. We told the clerk that we were not going to stay because of the constuction work they had assured us was not going on and she said there wes nothing she could do but to call tomorrow when her manager was there. We left and found a beautiful beach front hotel for less a couple of miles north in La Jolla. We called the manager, Al, the next morning and he was a rude, unreasonable, angry man who wouldn't even listen to our complaint but yelled, called us liers and charged our credit card for the amount of our room. We tried to not let it wreck our vacation and are now trying to contest the charges. We travel often and have never experienced anything so horrible. Please take our recommendations and do not even consider this hotel or you too will be very sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janet846
Reviews.Content: Do not be deceived into staying at the Ocean Park Inn. This is a dingy, old, musty hotel. Our bathroom was dirty when we checked in and had to be cleaned again. I then went to the lobby bathroom and it too was dirty. The staff is rude and unhelpful. We checked out early. The owners of this hotel are so cheap! They do nothing to improve the facility and would not even give me a newspaper on my last day. They wanted me to pay 50 cents since I was checking out. Unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights in late April and paid $178/night. I haven't stayed at a lot of San Diego hotels in order to compare to this, but based on my experience this is a very AVERAGE hotel. Average service, average facility, average room. I would hesitate to pay more than what I paid for the Ocean Park Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: stsc3009
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ocean Park Inn for 3 nights in October 2004 - booked via expedia. Room was very spacious and nicely furnished, cleaned every day. Parking in the underground garage is included in room charge, which is definitely a big plus!! Location is excellent, directly in front of the beach. Lots of restaurants and bars nearby, a supermarket is just across the street. Major San Diego attractions are easy to reach to by car. There are a few homeless people around, but that didn’t affect my stay. The neighbourhood felt pretty safe to me, even at night. But it might be good to ask the hotel for a room on 1st or 2nd floor when you book (my room was on 1st) In summary: good value for your money – recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our anniversary here and LOVED it. The construction on the balconies is long gone, and the constuction of the new lifeguard headquarters didn't bother us a bit. Each morning we woke up to the sites and sounds of the ocean- which was exactly what we were looking for. Breakfast at the hotel was good, but you have to try breakfast at Konos just up the boardwalk (about 2 blks north). It's well worth the wait! Our room was clean and functional (nothing fancy) and the bathroom was extremely clean with great water pressure in the shower- which was important to my husband! The hotel is small, so it was quiet and parking in the gated underground parking was easy. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Pacific beach is centrally located, so trips South to Coronado or North La Jolla were just 10-15 minutes by car. We would stay here again and would recommend it to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Can't figure out what other complain about???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just can't figure out what some people are complaining about. I have been going to OPI for the past 6 years(a week at a time) and I am going again this year. I have no desire to go anywhere else. The minute I get home I write on my calender the days left til my return. The staff has always been friendly. The accommidations are great, and I have never seen bugs, smelled anything bad or been awaken by anything other than a little construction which will only improve what is already a wonderful place. I think those of you that complain more than likely aren't happy anywhere you go. That's O.K., I'll take OPI anyday.

Reviews.Title: “We were ROBBED!!! DO NOT stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a horrible stay at this place. First of all, we arrived to find major construction work being done on balconies of rooms overlooking the pool, starting at 8 AM!!! Management was unwilling to negotiate our (already overpriced) rate, so not only were we awakened at 8 AM each morning we paid full price for this "wake-up call". And not only that, once the construction shift was over, the workers would head to the 7-11 across the street and buy some beer, and sit on the balconies of the rooms overlooing the pool and ogle the guests in the pool while drinking beer on the balconies!!! Our bedding wasn't changed despite specifically asking for housekeeping, and when we realised the room wasn't cleaned we called front desk who said, "too bad, the maids are gone home for the day". The pull-out bed in the suite we rented was extremely uncomfortable and no bedding was provided. There was also major construction on the boardwalk right next to the hotel as well, and to top it all off, we were ROBBED right in from of the hotel by one of the numerous homeless people just "hanging out" outside the hotel!!!!! We left our car unlocked for literally 30 seconds while we picked up a towel at front desk and someone stole our sunglasses, all our cds, the 6-cd changer in our cd player and my map!! Overall, DEFINITELY not worth the expensive rate. There are tons of other hotels to choose from: take it from me, choose another one!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: GetawayGangAlberta
Reviews.Content: We spent 11 nights at the Ocean Park Inn and enjoyed every one of them! Yes, there is construction going on in the hotel (they are replacing balcony decks and railings and air conditioners) and next door to it (they are rebuilding the lifeguard tower). We didn't find either project to be excessively noisy, in fact many rooms were closed so the hotel was quieter than it might have been and the flow on the boardwalk was interrupted so it was quieter as well. This hotel was somewhat removed from the "party" section of the beach which was great for our family, we only had to walk out our the secure hotel gate and a few feet down the boardwalk to reach the stairs to the beach. The room was very clean, the bathroom somewhat dated but large and the beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was great as well and they do now offer cream cheese with the bagels. The building is of wood construction so there is some sound transference, we could hear water running and loud discussions if they took place in the bathroom. Most of noise we heard was created by incredibly rude people who felt that having loud discussions in the hallway or letting their kids play soccer there was perfectly acceptable! They rank right up there with the ones who bypassed the handy outdoor shower and went straight into the pool or their rooms, sand and all. The pool was nicely warm and cleaned regularly. There are lots of restaruants nearby, our favorites were Taylor's (right next door) and Joe's Crab Shack (a few doors down). It was easy to drive to the attractions we wanted to see, Sea World was about a 10 minute drive away. Our view was overlooking a very old motel, however we could see the ocean and it was quiet. Our only issue with this hotel is that although it is a totally non-smoking hotel, they allow people to smoke on the balcony with the door closed. As a result we were treated to flicked ashes and the smell of cigarettes on several occasions.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: helen118
Reviews.Content: I have have just left the hotel less than 24 hours ago and what a great place to stay. The earlier person is correct there is building work going on next door to the hotel but you cant hear them. The location and view is the best i have stayed in. I sat in the balcony every night whatching the sun go down after the couple of steps from the beach. Hotels free breakfast is great along with the staff. Parking easy and safe. The outside heated pool great also. Shops across the road are good. Try Rharps. The two best bits advice I can give is eat at a great place on the broadwalk called the greenflash. JUst out of this world fish dinners. View great staff great. Just a brillent place. Also Seaworld. Be warned it is $7.00 to park then $51.00 each to get in. Good place to visit but not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “construction and noise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There is major construction happening right beside this hotel...and no one told us about it. Also, our room was on the first floor underneath construction of their own. So in addition to the other noise, we were awakened to workers actually standing outside our window yelling at the porch above. We had to leave the room the afternoon before because it was so noisy. Even if they finish construction on the hotel itself, the construction next door should take awhile. We reasonably requested a different room. We were just told that we couldn't be moved...there was no attempt at accommodation. They told us"well it doesn't start until 8:00". The "view" out the window was certainly the beach, if you could look past the construction workers, the wall, and the homeless. Even if no one was there, if you open the curtains to look out...everyone is staring back at you. I advise a different hotel, I didn't even recognize the place some people were describing, but if you book....check about the construction and get a second or third floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the friendly desk clerk offered to upgrade our room for free. So we booked a 1st floor room for the price and stayed in a 3rd floor room with a balcony and excellent view. The desk clerk also gave us discount coupons for area restaurants and advice on the best nights to eat where. (ex. the restaurant across the street has all you can eat crab legs one night a week they were great). It was a trip and experience my wife and I will treasure.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was there last weekend: I paid for ocean view, but I was put on the first floor so all I can see was the bums (so many around), the room was not what I was expecting - there was so smell going on, noisy (from the street, rooms next door, etc. Yes the ocean is right infront of you, but I prefer to stay at a better hotel and walk/drive to the ocean. The whole hotel was terrible - cheap and depressing. Go there if you don't care how comfortable you will feel and don't mind the noise and the bums. I'll never ever go there - that's for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great scenery”
Reviews.Author: WinnipegFamily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found this an excellent hotel. The view from our balcony was of the ocean and the sounds of crashing waves lulled you to sleep at night. The room was very large with an extra couch. The fridge and microwave were very handy. The bathroom was large and there was also a safe in the closet for valuables. The continental breakfast was amazing. So much selection and it was constantly being refilled throughout the morning. Housekeeping was very fast in getting your room clean. Most days it was done by the time we got back from breakfast. Free underground parking was also included. Room price was about $160 ($CAD) but we got the 4th night free through a promotional offer. Location wise, we had to drive everywhere but it wasn't too hard to find the sights we were looking for. The outdoor pool was heated and it could have been just a bit warmer but we used it anyway. The hot tub was great for temperature.

HotelInfo.Name: Ocean Park Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 710 Grand Ave, San Diego, CA 92109
